result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Christopher Andrew Nash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than August 2, 2016.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF555.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF555.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment. Remain in compliance with treatment program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Andrew Nash

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Christopher Andrew Nash appeared. Case called at 4:31 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. Files an amended information adding a Ct. 2 Misd. Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. Atty Olson makes statement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1 & 2 in 15CF555. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 15CF555 and court will withhold entry of judgment per the diversion agreement for a period of 1 year and finds DE GUILTY to Ct. 2 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia per the amended information.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 

Crt orders:

Count 2:

-  S/W 1 year probation. Report no later than August 2, 2016. 

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- AODA and follow through. Remain in compliance with treatment program

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. To be paid over the course of probation
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

DE is currently at work and there must have been a misunderstanding. Court will issue a bench warrant but will stay until 07-27-2016 at 4:15 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
